original_title: Weeks after reports that Meta was offering $100 million signing bonuses to poach OpenAI talent, it turns out the social media giant's chatbot ambitions aren't panning out so well - as the company has frozen hiring in its artificial intelligence division  — The Donald
article_summary: Meta has frozen hiring in its AI division due to challenges in developing chatbots, as highlighted by the failure of their chatbot ambitions. Users on the platform have discussed the limitations of AI, noting that it is only as good as the bias of its developers and does not possess actual intelligence.</s>
